data.title: "Amy Schumer" Podcast Summary with Jason Bateman, Will Arnett, Sean Hayes, Amy Schumer
data.meta_description: In this episode of SmartLess learn about Amy Schumer's stand-up comedy career, and other important topics. Read a summary today.
data.text:
Join comedy legends Dana Carvey and David Spade on "Fly on the Wall" as they delve into a delightful depths-and-highlights reel of laughs and learnings with their former "Saturday Night Live" castmate, Amy Poehler. This trove of memories unearths the adrenaline of live performance, the impact of technology on TV, and the cultural influence of 1970s cinema on their comedic craft. With stories of Christopher Walken's iconic appearances and sketches that still resonate across generations, this episode is a testament to the enduring spirit and camaraderie found within the walls of SNL.

As Poehler shares her evolution from portraying Hillary Clinton to spearheading her production company, Paper Kite, listeners get a rare peek into the challenges and triumphs of a comedianâs journey through the entertainment industry. Addressing topics from the advancement of women in comedy to the nuanced art of hosting, and even touching on societal pressures and personal well-being, this conversation is an intimate look into what it takes to stay sharp, creative, and genuine in the ever-changing world of comedy. Tune in to "Fly on the Wall" for a hearty dose of humor blended with wisdom from some of SNLâs finest.

This episode of Fly on the Wall paints an enthralling portrait of Leslie Jones, as she shares the twists and turns of her journey to comedy fame with hosts Dana Carvey and David Spade. Journey with Jones from her early career decisions, through the pressure-cooker environment of Saturday Night Live, to her notable role in "Ghostbusters", facing societal backlash and online vitriol but always holding firm. She also illuminates the complexities faced by female comedians in the industry and outlines some promising projects on the horizon.

In the episode, Jones, Carvey, and Spade delve into the evolution and commercialization of comedy in the digital age. They discuss the intricacies of stand-up comedy, the debate between shock comedy and traditional stand-up, as well as the challenges of crafting innovative comedic material for diverse audiences. Alongside these industry insights, Jonesâs narrative is one of resilience and defiance in the face of industry prejudice and stereotypes. This episode is a masterclass in persistence and recognizing your worth.

Dive into the intricacies of stand-up comedy with Tom Segura as he welcomes the accomplished Colin Quinn to "2 Bears, 1 Cave." This engaging episode peels back the curtain on what it truly means to connect with an audience, be it in conventional comedy clubs or the more challenging non-traditional venues. Segura shares his own awkward encounter with an athlete-centric crowd, while Quinn recounts the time he faced silence at Robert De Niro's birthday party, showcasing the unpredictable highs and lows of a comedianâs life.

From backstage anecdotes of "Saturday Night Live" to the evolution of comedic styles, the pair navigate through the comedy cosmos, generously sprinkling humor while sharing valuable lessons and personal setbacks. Quinnâs insider perspectives alongside Segura's candid experiences give listeners a rich tapestry of entertainment industry tales and tips, perfect for anyone passionate about the art of making people laugh or those curious about the realities of a life dedicated to comedy.

Tune in to "Fly on the Wall" for a hearty dose of humor blended with wisdom from some of SNLâs finest.

In this incisive installment of The Ben Shapiro Show, Ben Shapiro challenges the prevailing narratives on anti-Semitism, diversity initiatives, and U.S. politics with his guests Chuck Schumer, Eylon Levy, Chris Hayes, Ayelet Shaked, Sarah Hendriks, and Jim Jordan. Shapiro systematically dissects Schumer's speech against the rise of anti-Jewish sentiment, rejecting blame placed upon the pro-Palestine movement's ignorance, and suggesting that the left's fundamental ideologies arguably contribute to the propagation of hateful anti-Semitic theories. Tackling the role of Jews in diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, Shapiro provocatively inquires about their true effectiveness and impartiality, particularly in light of Elon Musk's recent criticisms of DEI.

The conversation then pivots to an in-depth examination of the Israeli-Palestinian milieu, showcasing Shapiro's deep-seated skepticism toward the fragile ceasefire and international peace efforts. He critically assesses the Palestinian Authority's governance capabilities post-Hamas and questions the UN's effectiveness in managing the issues at stake. Back on American soil, Shapiro dives into the dynamics of U.S. policies and upcoming elections, defending Kissinger's strategic diplomacy, while offering his take on the GOPâs potential Biden impeachment strategies and scrutinizing the inflation concerns looming over the Biden administration. As Ben Shapiro stands firmly at the intersection of political inquiry and societal critique, he engages with a vibrant panel of thinkers, leaving listeners pondering the difficult question: Where do we go from here?

My Name Is Barbra is the 1,000-page autobiography of Barbra Streisand, perhaps one of the most successful and well-rounded performers in history. As a testament to her career, Streisand is an EGOT winner (Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony awards), a feat that only 24 people have achieved.

This guide will take you through Streisandâs remarkable life, as told by Streisand herself. Weâll examine her personal lifeâhow she was raised, how she describes herself, and her various romantic relationships. Then weâll explore her extensive career. Finally, weâll discuss her legacy: her philanthropic work and what she hopes to leave behind after she passes away.

Our commentary will provide some background information about the entertainment industry and the people Streisand discusses. Weâll also examine some of the psychology behind Streisandâs drive to perform and escape from reality. Finally, weâll discuss what other prominent figuresâsuch as composer Paul Wiliamsâhave said about Streisand and her work.

Join Academy Award nominee Jessica Chastain and the playful trio of Jason Bateman, Will Arnett, and Sean Hayes on "SmartLess" as they take a deep dive into the world of acting, both on the vibrant stage of Broadway and beyond. Jessica opens up about the grueling demands and emotional journeys of live theater, sharing how her impressive 137-show run has left her craving the serenity of a Tahitian vacation. With anecdotes that resonate with any dedicated performer, this episode captures the passion, the pressure, and the profound need for recovery time that comes with the art of acting.

The conversation flows from Jessica's early career fostered by significant moments like a life-changing monologue contest win to her thoughts on maintaining creativity in seemingly repetitive roles. Peppered with lighthearted tales of on-stage mishaps and her unexpected culinary interests, the podcast shines a light on the diverse personality of an actress acclaimed for her versatile roles in science fiction and beyond. "SmartLess" hosts blend humor and insight offering listeners candid reflections on vulnerable moments in the spotlight and the strong work ethic forged by their upbringings. Tune in for an engaging blend of heartfelt revelation and infectious laughter and stay tuned for a preview of what's next with sports personality Rex Chapman.

In a stirring episode of "Wiser Than Me with Julia Louis-Dreyfus," acclaimed actress and activist Julia Louis-Dreyfus joins forces with renowned policy-maker and environmentalist Gina McCarthy and commentator Judith Bowles. With both women recounting their personal journeys into activism, and McCarthy's transition from a bystander to an environmentalist, it's a podcast enriched with personal fervor. Louis-Dreyfus dives deep into her childhood influenced by political activism, while McCarthy shares her discovery of her own activist passion later in life, and her inclination towards policy-making grounded in hard evidence.

Their conversation doesn't shirk away from the contentious issues either. Louis-Dreyfus and McCarthy examine the place of emotion in politics, the gender bias that continues to pervade the field, and the controversial topic of climate change skepticism. As the dialogue unfolds, they recount past mistakes like the Flint Water Crisis, while also touching on their respective efforts to balance activism with personal life. Itâs a podcast that blends admissions of past regrets with the wisdom acquired along a journey of dedicated activism.

In this significant episode of the Shawn Ryan Show, successful biotech investor and presidential hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy shares his revolutionary perspectives on the American political system. With a unique career straddling science, finance, and law, Ramaswamy sees through the well-worn norms of todayâs political and corporate climates, advocating for a reshuffling of long-established hierarchies in favor of younger, democratic-minded leadership. His candid discussion with Shawn Ryan spans across his political aspirations, critique of mainstream media, and his vision for a transformative era guided by informed leadership.

Pulling back the curtain on bureaucratic entities, America's pharmaceutical industry, and titanic asset management firms, Ramaswamy provides deep insights that challenge conventional understanding. His take on federal reform, his political evolution from libertarian to conservative, and his plans for invigorating Americaâs economy prompt us to think critically about the status quo. This episode is a thought-provoking exploration of socio-political structures through the eyes of an unconventional thinker on a mission to drive change.
